targets.rawSql:
select
	a.date,
	a.net_worth as "Net Worth"
from hledger.net_worth a
where 
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'

select
	a.date,
	a.balance / b.daily_expense as short_runaway
from (
	select
		a.date,
		sum(a.balance) as balance
	from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a 
	join hledger.assets_classification b on
		a.account = b.account and
		b.classification in (
			'Cash',  
			'Savings'
		) 
	where
		a.currency = '${commodity}'
	group by
		a.date	
) a
join hledger.average_daily_expenses b on
	a.date = b.date
where
	b.currency = '${commodity}' and
	b.daily_expense is not null and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'

select
	a.date,
	a.balance / b.daily_expense as long_runaway
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
join hledger.average_daily_expenses b on
	a.date = b.date and
	a.currency = b.currency
where
	a.account = 'Assets' and
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	b.daily_expense is not null and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'

select
	a.date,
	a.net_worth / (b.daily_expense * 365 * 25) as fire_percentage
from hledger.net_worth a
join hledger.average_daily_expenses b on
	a.date = b.date and
	a.currency = b.currency
where
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'

select
	a.date,
	b.net_worth,
	0 as baseline,
	-1 * a.daily_income * 365 * ${age:raw} / 10 / 2 as under_wealth,
	-1 * a.daily_income * 365 * ${age:raw} / 10 as expected_wealth,
	-1 * a.daily_income * 365 * ${age:raw} / 10 * 2 as over_wealth
from hledger.average_daily_income a
join hledger.net_worth b on
	a.date = b.date and
	a.currency = b.currency
where
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'

select
  a.date,
	b.classification,
	sum(balance) as amount
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
join hledger.assets_classification b on
	a.account = b.account
where
	currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'
group by
	a.date,
	b.classification
order by
	a.date

select
	a.date,
	a.daily_expense as "Expenses",
	-1 * b.daily_income as "Income",
	1 - ((-1 * a.daily_expense) / b.daily_income) as "Ratio"
from hledger.average_daily_expenses a
join hledger.average_daily_income b on
	a.date = b.date and
	a.currency = b.currency
where
	a.daily_expense is not null and
	b.daily_income is not null and
	a.currency = '${commodity}'  and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'

select
	a.date,
	-1 * sum(balance) / ${credit_limit} as "Ratio"
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
where
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.account = 'Liabilities' and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:yyyy-MM-DD}'
group by
	a.date
order by
	a.date

select
	a.date,
	b.classification,
	sum(balance) as amount
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
join hledger.assets_classification b on
	a.account = b.account
where
	currency = '${commodity}' and
	$__timeFilter(a.date)
group by
	a.date,
	b.classification
order by 
	a.date

select
  a.date,
	b.classification,
	sum(balance) as amount
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
join hledger.assets_classification b on
	a.account = b.account
where
	currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.date <= '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'
group by
	a.date,
	b.classification
order by 
	a.date desc

panels.description: Debt-to-income (DTI) ratio is the percentage of your monthly gross income that goes to paying your monthly debt payments and is used by lenders to determine your borrowing risk.

targets.rawSql:
select
	a.date,
	-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Liabilities' then balance else 0 end) as "Liabilities",
	-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Income' then balance else 0 end) as "Income",
	(
		sum(case when a.account = 'Liabilities' then balance else 0 end) /
		sum(case when a.account = 'Income' then balance else 0 end)
	) as "Ratio"
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
where
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.account in (
		'Liabilities',
		'Income'
	) and
	$__timeFilter(a.date)
group by
	a.date
order by
	a.date

panels.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio *

panels.description: The debt-to-net worth formula is a good one to be familiar with, as it can shed light on how financially healthy you are -- for you or for anyone assessing your financial condition.

targets.rawSql:
select
	a.date,
	-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Liabilities' then balance else 0 end) as "Liabilities",
	sum(balance) as "Net Worth",
	(
		(-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Liabilities' then balance else 0 end)) /
		sum(balance)
	) as "Ratio"
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
where
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.account in (
		'Liabilities',
		'Assets'
	) and
	$__timeFilter(a.date)
group by
	a.date
order by
	a.date

panels.title: Debt-to-Net Worht Ratio

panels.description: The Debt to Asset Ratio, also known as the debt ratio, is a leverage ratio that indicates the percentage of assets financed with debt. The higher the ratio, the greater the leverage and financial risk degree.

targets.rawSql:
select
	a.date,
	-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Liabilities' then balance else 0 end) as "Liabilities",
	sum(case when a.account = 'Assets' then balance else 0 end) as "Assets",
	(
		(-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Liabilities' then balance else 0 end)) /
		sum(case when a.account = 'Assets' then balance else 0 end)
	) as "Ratio"
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
where
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.account in (
		'Liabilities',
		'Assets'
	) and
	$__timeFilter(a.date)
group by
	a.date

panels.title: Debt-to-Assets Ratio

panels.description: The cash flow ratio helps you understand what percentage of your income is dedicated to your expenses. Think about the cash flow ratio as how much cash flows in vs flowing out.

targets.rawSql:
select
	a.date,
	a.daily_expense as "Expenses",
	-1 * b.daily_income as "Income",
	((-1 * a.daily_expense) / b.daily_income) as "Ratio"
from hledger.average_daily_expenses a
join hledger.average_daily_income b on
	a.date = b.date and
	a.currency = b.currency
where
	a.daily_expense is not null and
	b.daily_income is not null and
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.date between '${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD}' and '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'

panels.title: (Moving Average) Cash Flow Ratio

panels.description: The savings ratio is a measure of the proportion of an individual's income that is saved rather than spent on consumption. It is expressed as a percentage and indicates the financial health and stability of an individual.

targets.rawSql:
select
	a.date,
	sum(a.daily_savings) as "Savings",
	sum(-1 * b.daily_income) as "Income",
	-1 * sum(a.daily_savings / b.daily_income) as "Ratio"
from hledger.average_daily_savings a
join hledger.average_daily_income b on
	a.date = b.date and
	a.currency = b.currency
where
	a.daily_savings is not null and
	b.daily_income is not null and
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	a.date between '${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD}' and '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD}'
group by
	a.date

panels.title: (Moving Average) Savings Ratio

targets.rawSql:
select
	a.date,
	sum(balance) as "Retirement"
from hledger.balance_to_date_converted a
join hledger.assets_classification b on
	a.account = b.account
where
	a.currency = '${commodity}' and
	b.classification = 'Retirement' 
group by
	a.date
order by
	date desc

select
	a.date,
	-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Income' then a.balance else 0 end) over (order by a.date) as "Income",
	sum(case when a.account != 'Income' then a.balance else 0 end) over (order by a.date) as "Retirement",
	sum(case when a.account != 'Income' then a.balance else 0 end) over (order by a.date) / 
	(-1 * sum(case when a.account = 'Income' then a.balance else 0 end) over (order by a.date)) as "Ratio"
from hledger.daily_delta_converted a
left join hledger.assets_classification b on
	a.account = b.account
where
	$__timeFilter(a.date) and
	(
		a.account ='Income' or
		b.classification = 'Retirement'
	) and
	a.currency = '${commodity}'
order by
	a.date
